intro: Nephrodium erubescens, commonly known as the red kidney fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Davalliaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, kidney-shaped fronds that are typically reddish in color, especially when young. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its fronds are pinnately divided, with a soft, velvety texture and a pale underside. Nephrodium erubescens is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to tolerate a range of growing conditions.
